intro: Emerus aculeatus, commonly known as the prickly emerus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
